videoSnippet.title: Who Dares Play e4 Against Fabi? | Robson vs Caruana | US Championship 2018.
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Check out Robson's Amazing game here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3P4Kvlxh8o4&t=1s

Check out the interview with Caruana here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LIcK58xwFU - Interview starts at 3:56:15

The 2018 U.S. Championship is a 12-player round-robin featuring the strongest players in the USA, who compete for $194,000 in prize money as well as the coveted title of U.S. Champion. If two or more players tie for first place a playoff will be held.

For the 10th consecutive year the Saint Louis Chess Club is hosting the event. Players receive 90 minutes for the first 40 moves followed by 30 minutes for the rest of the game, with a 30-second increment from move one. Draw offers are not allowed before move 30. Official website: uschesschamps.com

Ray Robson vs Fabiano Caruana
US Championship (2018), St Louis, MO USA, rd 6, Apr-23 
Petrov Defense (C42)

1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Ne5 d6 4. Nf3 Ne4 5. Nc3 Nc3 6. dc3 Be7 7. Be3 O-O 8. Qd2 Nd7 9. O-O-O c6 10. Kb1 d5 11. c4 Nb6 12. cd5 Nd5 13. Bc4 Bf5 14. Bd5 cd5 15. Qd5 Qc8 16. Nd4 Bg6 17. Ka1 Re8 18. Rhe1 Bf6 19. c3 Re5 20. Qb3 a6 21. Bf4 Re1 22. Re1 Qd7 23. Be5 Re8 24. f4 Bd8 25. a4 h6 26. Rd1 Qg4 27. Rd2 b5 28. ab5 ab5 29. Qd1 Qd7 30. f5 Bg5 31. Rd3 Bf5 32. Nf5 Qf5 33. Bg3 Ra8 34. Kb1 Rd8 35. Kc2 b4 36. cb4 Rc8 37. Kb3 Qe6 38. Rd5 Rd8 39. Kc4 Qc6
